com.github.ilyes4j.gwt.mdl.components.menus

Interface IMenu

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Dropdown, Menu, MenuCombo

    public interface IMenu
    Every component that has menu related features should implement this interface.
    Author:
    Mohamed Ilyes DIMASSI

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addItem(String text, String value, boolean enabled)
      Adds a new option to the list of options in the menu.
      void addItemClickListener(Menu.ItemClickListener listener)
      When an object needs to be notified upon a MenuItem click, it must be be registered to the Menu as an Menu.ItemClickListener .

      In order to receive item click notifications, the object should : Implement the Menu.ItemClickListener interface Define the actions that should be performed when a MenuItem is clicked inside Menu.ItemClickListener.onItemClicked(ItemClickEvent) Call Menu.addItemClickListener(ItemClickListener) to register itself to the menu and receive click notifications
      void clearMenu()
      Remove all items from the menu.
      int getItemCount()
      Returns the items count in a menu.
      String getItemText(int index)
      return the text of the item located at the position provided as input.
      String getValue(int index)
      return the value of the item located at the position provided as input.
      boolean isEnabled(int index)
      Modify the enabled state of an item.
      void setAnchor(MenuAnchor anchor)
      Sets the position of the Menu on the screen related to its associated action button using one of the available anchoring options provided by MenuAnchor.

      An extra care should be taken when anchoring the menu.
      boolean setEnabled(int index, boolean enabled)
      Modify the enabled state of an item.

    • Method Detail

      • setAnchor

        void setAnchor(MenuAnchor anchor)
        Sets the position of the Menu on the screen related to its associated action button using one of the available anchoring options provided by MenuAnchor.

        An extra care should be taken when anchoring the menu. According to this thread , the menu's parent need a position:relative in order for the menu to be anchored correctly.
        Parameters:
        anchor - the requested Anchor position for the Menu .

      • clearMenu

        void clearMenu()
        Remove all items from the menu.

      • addItem

        void addItem(String text,
           String value,
           boolean enabled)
        Adds a new option to the list of options in the menu.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be displayed
        value - The value to be added
        enabled - Defines whether the option can be chosen or not.

      • addItemClickListener

        void addItemClickListener(Menu.ItemClickListener listener)
        When an object needs to be notified upon a MenuItem click, it must be be registered to the Menu as an Menu.ItemClickListener .

        In order to receive item click notifications, the object should :
        1. Implement the Menu.ItemClickListener interface
        2. Define the actions that should be performed when a MenuItem is clicked inside Menu.ItemClickListener.onItemClicked(ItemClickEvent)
        3. Call Menu.addItemClickListener(ItemClickListener) to register itself to the menu and receive click notifications
        Parameters:
        listener - The object to be notified when a MenuItem is clicked.
        See Also:
        Menu.ItemClickListener

      • getItemCount

        int getItemCount()
        Returns the items count in a menu.
        Returns:
        the items count in a menu

      • getItemText

        String getItemText(int index)
        return the text of the item located at the position provided as input.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the item
        Returns:
        the text of the item at input position

      • getValue

        String getValue(int index)
        return the value of the item located at the position provided as input.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the item
        Returns:
        the value of the item at input position

      • setEnabled

        boolean setEnabled(int index,
                 boolean enabled)
        Modify the enabled state of an item. The position of the item is provided as input
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the item in the item list of the menu
        enabled - the state to be set for the item
        Returns:
        true if the state was modified, false otherwise.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled(int index)
        Modify the enabled state of an item. The position of the item is provided as input
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the item in the item list of the menu
        Returns:
        true if the item is enabled, false otherwise.
